rev.comment: /* "Twenty percent" time */ As we now have a source, we can remove "are said to have"
rev.diff:
Line 76: Line 76:
==="Twenty percent" time===
==="Twenty percent" time===
â
Every Google engineer is encouraged to spend 20 percent (20%) of their work time on projects that interest them. The time can be allocated to one day a week, or pooled into a month. Some of Google's newer services, such as [[Gmail]], [[Google News]] and [[orkut]], are said to have originated from these independent endeavors. <ref> "[http://www.google.com/support/jobs/bin/static.py?page=about.html]." ''[http://www.google.com/ Google].'' Retrieved on [[July 30]], [[2006]].</ref> In a talk at [[Stanford University]], [[Marissa Mayer]] - Vice President of Search Products and User Experience at Google, stated that her analysis showed that 50% of new product launches came from 20% time.{{fact}}
+
Every Google engineer is encouraged to spend 20 percent (20%) of their work time on projects that interest them. The time can be allocated to one day a week, or pooled into a month. Some of Google's newer services, such as [[Gmail]], [[Google News]] and [[orkut]], originated from these independent endeavors.<ref> [http://www.google.com/support/jobs/bin/static.py?page=about.html Google Engineering Recruitment Page].</ref> In a talk at [[Stanford University]], [[Marissa Mayer]] - Vice President of Search Products and User Experience at Google, stated that her analysis showed that 50% of new product launches came from 20% time.{{fact}}
===Googleplex===
===Googleplex===
